item.title: Jeremiah add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "To fall in love is to create a religion that has a fallible god." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Jeremiah add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The true measure of a man is not his intelligence or how high he rises in this freak establishment. No, the true measure of a man is this: how quickly can he respond to the needs of others and how much of himself he can give." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Jeremiah add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Jeremiah add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jeremiah add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jeremiah add a quote by Robert Heinlein
item.description: "Men rarely if ever dream up a god superior to themselves. Most gods have the manners and morals of a spoiled child. " -- Robert Heinlein

item.title: Jeremiah add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Damnit! Nationalism should stop at the stratosphere!" -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jeremiah add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "History does not record anywhere at any time a religion that has any rational basis. Religion is a crutch for people not strong enough to stand up to the unknown without help. But, like dandruff, most people do have a religion and spend time and money on it and seem to derive considerable pleasure from fiddling with it." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jeremiah add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Logic is a feeble reed, friend. "Logic" proved that airplanes can't fly and that H-bombs won't work and that stones don't fall out of the sky. Logic is a way of saying that anything which didn't happen yesterday won't happen tomorrow." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jeremiah add a quote by John Brunner
item.description: "There are two kinds of fools. One says, "This is old, and therefore good." And one says, " This is new, and therefore better." -- John Brunner
